result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan Justice Novak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $6616.00 payable to Bank Mutual or Corporate Head (joint and several to Darionte Phifer and Tyrell Jefferson (co-actors).
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with 1105 (one thousand one hundred-five) days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.

- No contact with Bank Mutual, PNC, CVS Pharmacy, Marine Credit Union, Focus Credit Union, Landmark Credit Union, Mitchell Bank, Prime Financial Credit Union, Great Midwest Bank, co-actors Darionta Phifer, Tyrell Jefferson, Daunte N., Daquan M., Jody R., Christopher J. Lamontre W., Marquis D., Marquez V, Malik H. Qwesian S., Joey J-R, Clifford B. and Lydell N.

- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor.
-Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
-Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Jordan Justice Novak in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Defendant Jordan Justice Novak in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Charles R.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 114 MONTHS with 1105 (one thousand one hundred-five) days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 54 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 60 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS NOT eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with Bank Mutual, PNC, CVS Pharmacy, Marine Credit Union, Focus Credit Union, Landmark Credit Union, Mitchell Bank, Prime Financial Credit Union, Great Midwest Bank, co-actors Darionta Phifer,           Tyrell Jefferson, Daunte N., Daquan M., Jody R., Christopher J. Lamontre W., Marquis D., Marquez V, Malik H. Qwesian S., Joey J-R, Clifford B. and Lydell N.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $6616.00 payable to Bank Mutual or Corporate Head (joint and several to Darionte Phifer and Tyrell Jefferson (co-actors).
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obligations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

"Use of a Dangerous Weapon" penalty enhancer dismissed pursuant to plea negotiations.

Defendant Jordan Justice Novak in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Jordan Justice Novak in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.
 
AS TO COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  On motion of the State, Court orders the penalty enhancer "Use of a Dangerous Weapon" DISMISSED.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jordan Justice Novak in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Jordan Justice Novak in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
